Title: Ex Machina
Comments: There were so many plot twists that I was on edge all throughout the movie (in a good way of course). Oscar Issacâ€™s acting was amazing as well.

Title: Burning
Comments: I encountered Burning after my freshman year of college when I was feeling unsure of my future. Probably why it stood out so much for me and is one of my favorites till today.

Title: Chungking Express
Comments: Love the overall mood of the movie. In an alternate universe, I would be a heartbroken romantic crying over expired pineapples or perhaps a police officer in Hong Kong.

Title: Baby Driver
Comments: Loved the soundtrack, the speed, and comedy of the whole movie. Never a boring shot.

Title: Source Code
Comments: I remember watching Source Code for the first time at the theatre. I didn't think much of it at first but Source Code is a movie that grew on me the more I watched it.

Title: Punch Drunk Love
Comments: Punch Drunk Love was one of my highschool favorites. Very different from all the other PTA movies imo but I enjoyed how absurd the whole movie was.

Title: The Prestige
Comments: I find myself admiring how intricate and well thought out Nolan's movies are. The Prestige was especially striking because I never expected the ending.

Title: Clockwork Orange
Comments: Theres something about teenage rebellion and ultraviolence that makes for an exciting story.

Title: There will be Blood
Comments: Definitely my favorite PTA movie. Oil, family, money, blood. Theres almost too much symbolism in this movie that I feel like I'll never fully figure out everything PTA was thinking.

Title: The Batman
Comments: A recent favorite. Love the cinematography. The grimy city captured in its full. Reminds me a lot of New York.

Title: Howl's Moving Castle
Comments: Beautiful animation and very dreamy. Howl's Moving Castle is a favorite for me because it excels in what its trying to do and doesn't shy away from it at all.

Title: The Wind Rises
Comments: Loved the passion Jiro had for his work and the struggle to find a balance between life and work. As a creative, I thought there was a lot to admire about Jiro.

Title: Akira
Comments: I almost bought in to the hype around Akira because it has such a big cult following. Aside from all that, the handdrawn animation is beautiful and the Akira universe is very much believable.

Title: Perfect Blue
Comments: I'm still amazed this film was released in 1997.

Title: The Handmaiden
Comments: In the search for more Korean movies, I encountered The Handmaiden. I'm in love with the atmosphere of the movie and the amount of investment I had with characters in the film.

Title: Oldboy
Comments: The action scenes are iconic for a reason and every second of the movie was a treat to watch.

Title: Parasite
Comments: I ended up watching Parasite a couple times just because it was so big back when it won the Oscar. Even when watching it multiple times, I was able to find something new about the film each time around.

Title: Her
Comments: Watching Her the first time around was pretty offputting. The topic was super interesting though and the almost dystopic vibe of the movie was interesting.

Title: Moonlight
Comments: Moonlight is in this list primarily for its soundtrack. I love how a single melody develops & matures along with the main character. Just very poetic.

Title: Gravity
Comments: I remember the local movie theatre back when Gravity first premiered was screening it on a special big screen. The movie was great but going to the theatre with my dad and getting popcorn & all the ordeals was what makes Gravity special for me.

Title: Soul
Comments: I liked how the emphasis of Soul was on mundane life and appreciating it.

Title: Ratatoullie
Comments: Ratatoullie was one of my earlier encounters with animation and is still one of my favorites of all time. The characters are so simple yet they work for me.

Title: Boyhood
Comments: Boyhood felt very raw and genuine which I really appreciated.

Title: Fight Club
Comments: Rule 1 of Fight Club.

Title: The Lobster
Comments: The idea of dating as a life or death situation and turning people into animals sounds absurd but the way The Lobster conveys its story was nice.

Title: The Social Network
Comments: A part of me wants to be a tech bro and The Social Network allowed me to live that life vicariously.

Title: New World
Comments: I would never be able to join a gang nevertheless threaten anyone but seeing actors play the role out in style was exciting.

Title: Moonrise Kingdom
Comments: I had a teacher in highschool who was really into coming of age films and he introduced me to Moonrise Kingdom. The colors are nice, too.

Title: Trainspotting
Comments: Another teenage rebellion movie. Nothing new but enjoyed it.

Title: Memories of Murder
Comments: Murder mystery with an unresolved ending. I enjoyed how the main character progresses throughout the movie and seeing how low he could stoop for the sake of justice.
